Package net.flytre.mechanix.api.energy

Class EnergyEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraft.block.entity.BlockEntity
      • net.flytre.mechanix.api.energy.EnergyEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.fabricmc.fabric.api.block.entity.BlockEntityClientSerializable, net.fabricmc.fabric.api.screenhandler.v1.ExtendedScreenHandlerFactory, TieredMachine, net.minecraft.screen.NamedScreenHandlerFactory, net.minecraft.screen.ScreenHandlerFactory, net.minecraft.util.Tickable
    public abstract class EnergyEntity
extends net.minecraft.block.entity.BlockEntity
implements net.minecraft.util.Tickable, net.fabricmc.fabric.api.screenhandler.v1.ExtendedScreenHandlerFactory, net.fabricmc.fabric.api.block.entity.BlockEntityClientSerializable, TieredMachine
    The Energy entity class is for BlockEntities with energy.

    properties: The property delegate for screen handlers. You can use indices 8-11 for your custom subclasses, 0 - 7 are reserved by the energy entity class

    • Field Detail

      • energyMode

        public java.util.HashMap<net.minecraft.util.math.Direction,java.lang.Boolean> energyMode
        Which sides can input / output energy. Setting a side to false means it can only input, and true means only output

      • ioMode

        public java.util.HashMap<net.minecraft.util.math.Direction,java.lang.Boolean> ioMode
        Which sides can input / output items/fluids. Same as above

      • panelMode

        protected int panelMode
        Determines in the machine's screen whether the configuration panel on the right will toggle energy io or item io. 0 is energy, 1 is item

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnergyEntity

        public EnergyEntity​(net.minecraft.block.entity.BlockEntityType<?> type)
        Instantiates a new Energy entity.
        Parameters:
        type - the type

    • Method Detail

      • syncEntity

        public void syncEntity()
        Sync entity info client-side. Useful when doing custom block entity renders.

      • getProperties

        public net.minecraft.screen.PropertyDelegate getProperties()
        Gets the property delegate - This tells the screen / screenhandler info about the entity which is used in rendering. Remember that indices 8 -11 can be set to ints of your choice, but 0 - 7 are reserved.
        Returns:
        the properties

      • updateDelegate

        protected void updateDelegate()
        Update the delegate. Should be overriden and call by energy entities that want to give any custom information to the screen: Example, for a furnace how long until the recipe finishes to render the arrow.

      • fromTag

      • requestEnergy

        public void requestEnergy​(double amt)
        Request energy. Call every tick if you want your entity to actually receive energy which is usually the case unless its a generator. This will handle all the logic, you need not worry about that!
        Parameters:
        amt - the amt

      • setEnergyMode

        public void setEnergyMode​(boolean up,
                          boolean down,
                          boolean north,
                          boolean east,
                          boolean south,
                          boolean west)
        Sets the energy mode, usually called in the constructor. Remember this controls which sides can input or output energy by default.
        Parameters:
        up - the up
        down - the down
        north - the north
        east - the east
        south - the south
        west - the west

      • setIOMode

        public void setIOMode​(boolean up,
                      boolean down,
                      boolean north,
                      boolean east,
                      boolean south,
                      boolean west)
        Same as set energy mod but for fluids/items.
        Parameters:
        up - the up
        down - the down
        north - the north
        east - the east
        south - the south
        west - the west
